verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to them that go <WH3381> down <WH3381> to Egypt <WH4714> for help; <WH5833> and stay <WH8172> on <WH5921> horses, <WH5483> and trust <WH982> in chariots, <WH7393> because <WH3588> they are many; <WH7227> and in horsemen, <WH6571> because <WH3588> they are very <WH3966> strong; <WH6105> but they look <WH8159> not to the Holy <WH6918> One of Israel, <WH3478> neither <WH3808> seek <WH1875> the LORD! <WH3068>

Yet he also <WH1571> is wise, <WH2450> and will bring <WH935> evil, <WH7451> and will not call <WH5493> back <WH5493> his words: <WH1697> but will arise <WH6965> against <WH5921> the house <WH1004> of the evildoers, <WH7489> and against <WH5921> the help <WH5833> of them that work <WH6213> iniquity. <WH205>

Now the Egyptians <WH4714> are men, <WH120> and not God; <WH410> and their horses <WH5483> flesh, <WH1320> and not spirit. <WH7307> When the LORD <WH3068> shall stretch <WH5186> out his hand, <WH3027> both he that helps <WH5826> shall fall, <WH3782> and he that is helped <WH5826> shall fall <WH5307> down, and they all <WH3605> shall fail <WH3615> together. <WH3162>

For thus <WH3541> has the LORD <WH3068> spoken <WH559> to me, Like as the lion <WH738> and the young <WH3715> lion <WH3715> roaring <WH1897> on <WH5921> his prey, <WH2964> when <WH834> a multitude <WH4393> of shepherds <WH7462> is called <WH7121> forth against <WH5921> him, he will not be afraid <WH2865> of their voice, <WH6963> nor <WH3808> abase <WH6031> himself for the noise <WH1995> of them: so <WH3651> shall the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> come <WH3381> down <WH3381> to fight <WH6633> for mount <WH2022> Zion, <WH6726> and for the hill <WH1389> thereof.

As birds <WH6833> flying, <WH5774> so <WH3652> will the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> defend <WH1598> Jerusalem; <WH3389> defending <WH1598> also he will deliver <WH5337> it; and passing <WH5674> over he will preserve <WH4422> it.
Turn <WH7725> you to him from whom <WH834> the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> have deeply <WH6009> revolted. <WH5627>

For in that day <WH3117> every man <WH376> shall cast <WH3988> away <WH3988> his idols <WH457> of silver, <WH3701> and his idols <WH457> of gold, <WH2091> which <WH834> your own hands <WH3027> have made <WH6213> to you for a sin. <WH2399>

Then shall the Assyrian <WH804> fall <WH5307> with the sword, <WH2719> not of a mighty <WH376> man; <WH376> and the sword, <WH2719> not of a mean <WH120> man, <WH120> shall devour <WH398> him: but he shall flee <WH5127> from the sword, <WH2719> and his young <WH970> men shall be discomfited. <WH4522>

And he shall pass <WH5674> over <WH5674> to his strong <WH5553> hold <WH5553> for fear, <WH4032> and his princes <WH8269> shall be afraid <WH2865> of the ensign, <WH5251> said <WH5002> the LORD, <WH3068> whose <WH834> fire <WH217> is in Zion, <WH6726> and his furnace <WH8574> in Jerusalem. <WH3389>
